stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Emails with Snowden Salary Theme Includes Malware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 7 January 2015, a U.S. Government Department received three versions of a phishing email. The emails sent from nick.macpherson.uk@gmail.com used the subject "Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries for Silence?" and the malicious attachment "Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries.jar" (MD5: 89e2fa26f1218ce0c7f826eb7197cd07). The other email was sent from pmimoza.partners@gmail.com with the subject "RE: Important Confidential Document" and the same attachment renamed as "Confidential Document.jar". The malware called back to www.euronet.ns01.biz.
The email indicators in this campaign were observed in many previous campaigns associated with Team 338 (Chili Chi).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL SAMPLE ---- Subject: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries for Silence? From: Macpherson Nick <nick.macpherson.uk@gmail.com>; To: european.action.group@gmail.com; Date: Wed Jan 07 01:31:44 GMT 2015 BCC: [REDACTED] Attachment: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries.jar ---- END EMAIL SAMPLE ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- One aspect of the Snowden story that hasn't received much attention is the outrageous salary that Edward Snowden was receiving. I find that as equally disturbing as the numerous illegal and serious violations of privacy committed by the NSA. ---- END EMAIL BODY ----
The sender nick.macpherson.uk@gmail.com was previously used in many similar phishing campaigns, most recently in IB-14-10190, IB-14-10166, IB-14-10118, and IB-13-10810.
The email recipient european.action.group@gmail.com was previously used as a sender in similar phishing campaigns described in IB-13-10695 and CIB-20130305-02.

EmailMessageObj:Header.EmailMessageObj:Subject: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries for Silence?

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL SAMPLE ---- Subject: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries for Silence? From: Macpherson Nick <nick.macpherson.uk@gmail.com>; To: secretariat.lukash@gmail.com; Date: Wed Jan 07 02:05:46 GMT 2015 BCC: [REDACTED] Attachment: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries.jar ---- END EMAIL SAMPLE ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- One aspect of the Snowden story that hasn't received much attention is the outrageous salary that Edward Snowden was receiving. I find that as equally disturbing as the numerous illegal and serious violations of privacy committed by the NSA. ---- END EMAIL BODY ----
The recipient secretariat.lukash@gmail.com was previously used in many phishing campaigns described in AR-13-10014 and more recently in IB-14-10625.

EmailMessageObj:Header.EmailMessageObj:Subject: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries for Silence?

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL SAMPLE ---- From: Mimoza Peza <pmimoza.partners@gmail.com>; To: nick.macpherson.uk@gmail.com; Bcc: [REDACTED] Date: Wed Jan 07 07:35:49 GMT 2015 Subject: RE: Important Confidential Document Attachment: Confidential Document.jar ---- END EMAIL SAMPLE ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- Dear Participant, You are requested to view an important document for your perusal. This document have been uploaded using Google Apps/docs secured file uploader as I don't have a PDF converter. You are required to sign in with your email to view this confidential document I hope you find this as useful as I have. Respectfully, Administration Committee 2015 ---- END EMAIL BODY ----
The file attached to this email is the same file with the same MD5 hash value but the name was "Confidential Document.jar".
The sender pmimoza.partners@gmail.com was also used in many previous campaigns described in AR-13-10014, and more recently in IB-14-10563 and IB-14-10181.

This file is version 1.0.0.3 of a publicly available tool called Adzok Remote Administration Tool Free edition. Once executed, the JAR file makes a copy of itself and places it at "C:\WINDOWS\system32\Winhttpsvc.jar".
Observed names for this file include: Snowden's and NSA's High Salaries.jar Confidential Document.jar Winhttpsvc.jar
The file Winhttpsvc.jar (MD5: 89e2fa26f1218ce0c7f826eb7197cd07) contains numerous class files and .jar file, which aids in functionality.

The malware performs a DNS query for this domain, then sends the resolution of the domain with a four-byte string over TCP port 80:
---- REQUEST DATA START ---- 00000000 ac ed 00 05 .... ---- REQUEST DATA END ----
